verses.kjv: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where was a garden, into the which he entered, and his disciples.
verses.ct: After saying all this, Jesus left with his disciples and crossed the Kidron Valley. There was a garden on the other side, and he and his disciples went into it.

verses.kjv: And Judas also, which betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples.
verses.ct: Judas, his betrayer, was familiar with this spot because Jesus had often gathered there with his disciples.

verses.kjv: Judas then, having received a band of men and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.
verses.ct: So Judas arrived there with a detachment of soldiers and temple guards sent by the chief priests and Pharisees, carrying lanterns, torches, and weapons.

verses.kjv: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them, Whom seek ye?
verses.ct: Jesus, fully aware of everything that was about to happen to him, stepped forward and asked them, "Who are you looking for?"

verses.kjv: They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith unto them, I am he. And Judas also, which betrayed him, stood with them.
verses.ct: "Jesus of Nazareth," they replied. Jesus told them, "I am he." Judas, the one betraying him, was standing right there with them.

verses.kjv: As soon then as he had said unto them, I am he, they went backward, and fell to the ground.
verses.ct: The moment Jesus said, "I am he," they stumbled backward and collapsed to the ground.

verses.kjv: Then asked he them again, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.
verses.ct: So he asked them once more, "Who are you looking for?" They answered again, "Jesus of Nazareth."

verses.kjv: Jesus answered, I have told you that I am he: if therefore ye seek me, let these go their way:
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "I already told you that I am he. So if I'm the one you want, let these others go free."

verses.kjv: That the saying might be fulfilled, which he spake, Of them which thou gavest me have I lost none.
verses.ct: This happened to fulfill what he had previously said: "I have not lost a single one of those you gave me."

verses.kjv: Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it, and smote the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
verses.ct: At that point, Simon Peter, who had a sword, pulled it out and struck the high priest's servant, slicing off his right ear. The servant's name was Malchus.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus unto Peter, Put up thy sword into the sheath: the cup which my Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?
verses.ct: Jesus said to Peter, "Put your sword back in its sheath. Should I not drink the cup that my Father has given me?"

verses.kjv: Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus, and bound him,
verses.ct: Then the soldiers, their commander, and the Jewish temple guards seized Jesus and tied him up.

verses.kjv: And led him away to Annas first; for he was father in law to Caiaphas, which was the high priest that same year.
verses.ct: They brought him first to Annas, who was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.

verses.kjv: Now Caiaphas was he, which gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
verses.ct: Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jewish leaders that it would be better for one man to die on behalf of the people.

verses.kjv: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple: that disciple was known unto the high priest, and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest.
verses.ct: Simon Peter and another disciple followed Jesus. That other disciple had a connection with the high priest, so he was able to enter the high priest's courtyard along with Jesus.

verses.kjv: But Peter stood at the door without. Then went out that other disciple, which was known unto the high priest, and spake unto her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.
verses.ct: Peter, however, had to wait outside by the gate. So the other disciple, who knew the high priest, went back out and spoke to the woman guarding the entrance, and she let Peter in.

verses.kjv: Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter, Art not thou also one of this man’s disciples? He saith, I am not.
verses.ct: The servant girl at the gate asked Peter, "Aren't you one of this man's followers too?" He replied, "No, I'm not."

verses.kjv: And the servants and officers stood there, who had made a fire of coals; for it was cold: and they warmed themselves: and Peter stood with them, and warmed himself.
verses.ct: The servants and guards had built a charcoal fire because it was cold, and they stood around it warming themselves. Peter joined them and warmed himself as well.

verses.kjv: The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and his teaching.

verses.kjv: Jesus answered him, I spake openly to the world; I ever taught in the synagogue, and in the temple, whither the Jews always resort; and in secret have I said nothing.
verses.ct: Jesus answered him, "I have spoken publicly for everyone to hear. I always taught in synagogues and in the temple, where all the Jewish people gather. I never said anything in secret."

verses.kjv: Why askest thou me? ask them which heard me, what I have said unto them: behold, they know what I said.
verses.ct: "Why are you asking me? Ask the people who listened to me. They know exactly what I said."

verses.kjv: And when he had thus spoken, one of the officers which stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?
verses.ct: When Jesus said this, one of the guards standing nearby slapped him across the face and said, "Is that how you answer the high priest?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered him, If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil: but if well, why smitest thou me?
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "If I said something wrong, point out what was wrong about it. But if what I said was right, why did you hit me?"

verses.kjv: Now Annas had sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.
verses.ct: Annas then sent him, still tied up, to Caiaphas the high priest.

verses.kjv: And Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. They said therefore unto him, Art not thou also one of his disciples? He denied it, and said, I am not.
verses.ct: Simon Peter was still standing by the fire warming himself. Some of those around him asked, "Aren't you one of his followers too?" He denied it and said, "No, I'm not."

verses.kjv: One of the servants of the high priest, being his kinsman whose ear Peter cut off, saith, Did not I see thee in the garden with him?
verses.ct: One of the high priest's servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, challenged him: "Didn't I see you with him in the garden?"

verses.kjv: Peter then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.
verses.ct: Peter denied it once more, and right at that moment a rooster crowed.

verses.kjv: Then led they Jesus from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment: and it was early; and they themselves went not into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled; but that they might eat the passover.
verses.ct: Then they brought Jesus from Caiaphas to the Roman governor's headquarters. It was early morning. The Jewish leaders themselves did not go inside the building, because they didn't want to become ceremonially unclean — they still needed to eat the Passover meal.

verses.kjv: Pilate then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?
verses.ct: So Pilate came outside to them and asked, "What charges are you bringing against this man?"

verses.kjv: They answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.
verses.ct: They answered, "If he weren't a criminal, we wouldn't have brought him to you."

verses.kjv: Then said Pilate unto them, Take ye him, and judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death:
verses.ct: Pilate told them, "Then take him yourselves and judge him by your own law." The Jewish leaders responded, "We don't have the authority to execute anyone."

verses.kjv: That the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying what death he should die.
verses.ct: This took place so that what Jesus had said about the kind of death he would die would be fulfilled.

verses.kjv: Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?
verses.ct: Pilate went back inside the headquarters, summoned Jesus, and asked him, "Are you the King of the Jews?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered him, Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or did others tell it thee of me?
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "Are you asking this on your own, or did other people tell you this about me?"

verses.kjv: Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me: what hast thou done?
verses.ct: Pilate shot back, "Do I look like a Jew? Your own people and the chief priests handed you over to me. What did you do?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom were of this world, then would my servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "My kingdom doesn't belong to this world. If my kingdom were of this world, my followers would have fought to prevent me from being handed over to the Jewish leaders. But my kingdom is not from here."

verses.kjv: Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then? Jesus answered, Thou sayest that I am a king. To this end was I born, and for this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.
verses.ct: Pilate pressed him, "So you are a king then?" Jesus replied, "You say that I am a king. The reason I was born and came into the world is to testify to the truth. Everyone who belongs to the truth listens to my voice."

verses.kjv: Pilate saith unto him, What is truth? And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find in him no fault at all.
verses.ct: Pilate asked him, "What is truth?" After saying this, he went back outside to the Jewish leaders and told them, "I find absolutely no basis for any charge against him."

verses.kjv: But ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover: will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
verses.ct: "But you have a tradition where I release one prisoner to you during Passover. Do you want me to release the King of the Jews?"

verses.kjv: Then cried they all again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.
verses.ct: They all shouted back, "Not him! Give us Barabbas!" Now Barabbas was a violent criminal.
